name: 英語會話（一）
comment: 建議修習輔系第一年時選修
restrict: ◎限本系(含雙主修)、輔系修習◎限大一修習
goals: to elevate students’ confidence and motivation to participate in English conversation
to broaden their knowledge pertaining to English conversation
to enhance their skills in conducting English conversation
syllabus:
**Objective:** Students will improve their ability to express their ideas and opinions clearly and coherently through preparing and presenting material on personal interests / experiences and current affairs for group discussions. Whenever appropriate students will draw on self-selected authentic materials.  
Students will also be given instruction on how to improve their language skills, with particular emphasis on comprehensible input and autonomous learning.  
Schedule:  
The course is divided into three tasks with students being required to do one presentation per task. The tasks are:

Task One: ‘True Stories’  
Students will be introduced to the basic skills needed to prepare and give an effective presentation. The task involves the presenting and exchange of true stories in small groups as well as follow-up discussions.

Task Two: ‘Time for a Change’  
Students will prepare presentations to propose improvements to a present-day situation.

Task Three: ‘Articles for Discussion’  
Students will use self-selected authentic materials from newspapers, magazines and commercial online sources to investigate and prepare a presentation on an issue of contemporary concern.

**Class Activities:**  
Lecturing / Presentations / Group and Class Discussions

**Evaluation:**  
Attendance: 10%  
Presentations: 60%  
Active involvement in discussions and debates: 30%

**Course Material:**  
There is no set textbook for this course. Students will be encouraged and expected to make use of personal experiences and authentic materials as appropriate when preparing their presentations.
prerequisite: ◎Exclusive for students within this department(including dual degree program) ◎Exclusive for students taking minor within this department ◎Exclusive for freshman
